item.title: Carly add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Carly add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Carly add a quote by Lawrence Ferlinghetti
item.description: "I am awaiting perpetually and forever a renaissance of wonder" -- Lawrence Ferlinghetti

item.title: Carly add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Carly add a quote by Sherman Alexie
item.description: "At the halfway point of any drunken night, there is a moment when an Indian realizes he cannot turn back toward tradition and that he has no map to guide him toward the future." -- Sherman Alexie

item.title: Carly add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Carly add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description:
"I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart)I am never without it (anywhere I go you go,my dear; and whatever is done by only me is your doing,my darling) I fear no fate (for you are my fate,my sweet)I want no world (for beautiful you are my world,my true) and it's you are whatever a moon has always meant and whatever a sun will always sing is you
here is the deepest secret nobody knows (here is the root of the root and the bud of the bud and the sky of the sky of a tree called life; which grows higher than the soul can hope or mind can hide) and this is the wonder that's keeping the stars apart
I carry your heart (I carry it in my heart)" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Carly add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Reality means you live until you die...the real truth is nobody wants reality." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Carly add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "The weight of the world is love. Under the burden of solitude, under the burden of dissatisfaction the weight,the weight we carry is love. " -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Carly add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
Carly add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "America I've given you all and now I'm nothing." -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Carly add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Carly add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Carly add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "So eager are our people to obliterate the present." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Carly add a quote by franz kafka
item.description: "Slept, awoke, slept, awoke, miserable life." -- franz kafka

item.title: Carly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "The trouble was, I had been inadequate all along, I simply hadn't thought about it." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Carly add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description:
"Backward we traveled to reclaim the day Before we fell, like Icarus, undone; All we find are altars in decay And profane words scrawled black across the sun.
--From the poem "Doom of the Exiles", written 16 April 1954" -- Sylvia Plath
